      • performSimulation

        public DistributedSystem performSimulation()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception

      • createObjectReferences

        private void createObjectReferences()
        While parsing the input file, all the linking between various objects happen via their names. These are essentially strings. At runtime, since searching for a particular component via their name would involve string search for a gazillion times, it would not scale. This method hence converts all the string names to their respective object references for the *Sim classes. These references are then used by the simulation logic to invoke appropriate methods on the various components of the distributed system.

      • clearValuesButKeepConfInts

        private static void clearValuesButKeepConfInts()
        Clear the variables and all other book keeping data-structures for a daisy-fresh simulation to run.

      • startSimulation

        public void startSimulation()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Start the simulation. Generate initial set of requests (for cold system). Once the simulation starts rolling, it takes care of the warmup and cooldown, and all other intermediate tasks of a simulation. Keep processing the event list, till the SIMULATION_ENDS event is encountered. This method is equivalent to one simulation where no parameters are changing. Once a load parameter / configuration parameter changes, its essentially a different simulation. Before the input script can do such a thing, this method would have finished running by design. Next simulation would be the next run of this method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • generateRequestsForOpenSystem

        public void generateRequestsForOpenSystem()
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This function generates random requests for each of the scenarios(given their arrival rates). We assume right now that the arrival rates are Poisson(lambda). So inter arrival rates will be Exp(1/lambda). Each scenario will have separate arrival rates. And we will generate one requests of each scenario and add to the event list A request is generated for each scenario
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
